body: ReferencesA matter of getting all that right . . .Its consciousness of my white consciousness,Through the back of the picture at the patch of whiteAnd still my mind goes groping in the mud to bringThe place the road ends, that patch of white paintUpon from the right by far trees, that white placeSummer bees were sayingwill be penciled on the coffeeshop menus.And beyond, the same sound of beesI seek, above all, in the wanderingXX. To the PoleTo listen, by the sputtering, smoking fire,Clear-voiced despite its years, strong, eloquentLike an old soldier, wakeful, in his tent!But what I am looking at is hardened snow,The winged winds, captives of that age-old foeShadows keep piling up as surfacesOf meaning like thesethe world created by
